meanings.definition: Ready to accept and follow instructions or commands.
meanings.sent1: The dog was very biddable and learned tricks quickly.
meanings.sent2: She was a biddable student who always completed her homework on time.
meanings.sent3: The robot, programmed to be biddable, diligently carried out its tasks.
meanings.sent4: His biddable nature made him the perfect candidate for the job.
meanings.sent5: The biddable horse trotted obediently along the trail.

meanings.definition: Capable of being bid or commanded.
meanings.sent1: The auctioneer was pleased to see so many biddable items up for sale.
meanings.sent2: The workers were biddable and followed the supervisor's directions without question.
meanings.sent3: The biddable machines hummed to life at the push of a button.
meanings.sent4: The ocean, biddable by the moon's pull, ebbed and flowed with the tides.
meanings.sent5: The biddable wind changed direction as if responding to a silent command.
